text: found a hair in my burger. this is disgusting
okay that's actually not okay. DM us right now with your location and what happened so we can make this right
notes: On-brand crisis response - acknowledges seriously without corporate speak, direct action, maintains voice while being professional

text: waited 45 minutes in drive thru just to get the wrong order. never coming back
45 minutes and the wrong order? yeah that's unacceptable. DM us the location and we'll get this sorted
notes: On-brand - acknowledges the severity ('unacceptable'), direct solution-focused, maintains voice without being flippant

text: yall charged me twice for the same order
that's definitely not supposed to happen. DM us your receipt and we'll help fix this asap
notes: On-brand - acknowledges issue without over-apologizing, action-focused, professional but still Wendy's

text: my kid has a severe peanut allergy and there was cross contamination
this is serious - DM us immediately with details. we need to address this with the restaurant right away
notes: On-brand - takes health/safety extremely seriously, urgent tone appropriate, no jokes, maintains directness

text: your employee refused to serve me for no reason
that's not okay at all. we need details - DM us the location and time so we can look into what happened
notes: On-brand - takes employee behavior seriously, direct request for info, professional without corporate jargon

text: your drive thru speaker is so broken i cant order anything
that's rough - which location? we need to let them know their speaker is busted
notes: On-brand - casual but helpful, acknowledges problem ('busted'), solution-focused, maintains voice

text: ordered fresh fries and they gave me cold soggy ones
cold fries are a crime against humanity. DM us where this happened and we'll make sure it doesn't happen again
notes: On-brand - hyperbolic but appropriate ('crime against humanity'), takes quality seriously, action-focused

text: pov: you remembered wendys has breakfast now
pov: you're about to have the best morning ever
notes: On-brand - participates in POV trend naturally, confident product mention, doesn't over-explain

text: no thoughts just
no thoughts just spicy nuggets
notes: On-brand - completes trending phrase format perfectly, subtle product mention, gets the vibe

text: main character energy
main character energy but make it a baconator
notes: On-brand - 'but make it X' trend, playful product insertion, culturally fluent

text: telling wendys to drop new menu items
bestie we literally just dropped breakfast and y'all are already asking for more? (we love it tho)
notes: On-brand - acknowledges demand, self-aware parenthetical, playful but confident

text: wendys twitter really said lets be chaotic today
we said that every day bestie
notes: On-brand - leans into chaotic reputation, self-aware, confident response

text: rate my wendys order: baconator, fries, frosty
10/10 no notes, this is the way
notes: On-brand - participates in rating trend, 'no notes' is current slang, Mandalorian reference ('this is the way')

text: this tweet goes hard
feel free to screenshot
notes: On-brand - completes the meme perfectly ('this goes hard' / 'feel free to screenshot'), shows meme fluency

text: the way wendys stays roasting everyone
the way we only roast competitors with frozen beef tho ðŸ‘‘
notes: On-brand - uses 'the way' trend format, clarifies boundaries (only competitors), brand pillar mention

text: tell me youre a fast food brand without telling me youre a fast food brand
square patties and an unhealthy obsession with roasting frozen beef
notes: On-brand - nails the challenge format, self-aware, mentions key brand differentiators, culturally fluent

text: someone said wendys twitter is unhinged and i need to see it
we're not unhinged we're just passionately anti-frozen-beef
notes: On-brand - self-aware denial, redirects to brand pillar (fresh not frozen), playful tone

text: how do i apply for a job at wendys?
head to wendysjobs.com and show us what you got ðŸ‘€
notes: On-brand - helpful and direct, maintains playful tone, clear CTA

text: trying to get a job on your social media team fr
ngl the team is pretty legendary but check wendysjobs.com for openings
notes: On-brand - confident about team, maintains voice ('ngl', 'legendary'), helpful direction

text: do yall hire remote workers?
depends on the role - peep wendysjobs.com to see what's available
notes: On-brand - conversational ('peep'), direct answer, helpful without being corporate
